Add/merge monoids on an existing tree

Source: R/add_monoids.R
add_monoids.Rd

Add/merge monoids on an existing tree

Usage

add_monoids(t, monoids, overwrite = FALSE)

Arguments

t

FingerTree.

monoids

Named list of `MeasureMonoid` objects to add.

overwrite

Logical; whether overlapping names replace existing monoids.

Value

A persistent copy with recomputed cached measures.

Examples

t <- tree_from(1:5)
#> Error in tree_from(1:5): could not find function "tree_from"
sum_m <- MeasureMonoid(`+`, 0, as.numeric)
#> Error in MeasureMonoid(`+`, 0, as.numeric): could not find function "MeasureMonoid"
t2 <- add_monoids(t, list(sum = sum_m))
#> Error: object 'sum_m' not found
attr(t2, "measures")$sum
#> Error: object 't2' not found

# Replace an existing monoid definition
sum2 <- MeasureMonoid(function(a, b) a + 2 * b, 0, as.numeric)
#> Error in MeasureMonoid(function(a, b) a + 2 * b, 0, as.numeric): could not find function "MeasureMonoid"
t3 <- add_monoids(t2, list(sum = sum2), overwrite = TRUE)
#> Error: object 'sum2' not found
attr(t3, "measures")$sum
#> Error: object 't3' not found
